title: [Large-Scale] IMS Learning Design Runtime Change Management: Hierarchical Petri Net-Based Social Learning Approach and Structural Consistency Verification

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of IMS learning design and basic Petri net concepts, elementary education practical experience, and foundational knowledge of social learning systems
context.additional_context: Constructing a practice-oriented collaborative learning environment in smartphone-based, limited technological settings. It emphasizes the design and evaluation of citizen-participatory educational activities.

learning_goals: When modifying learning flows, hierarchical Petri net models can verify structural consistency in social learning environments.
Application scenarios for safe mode and unsafe mode can be distinguished from the perspectives of educational systems and citizen engagement.
Learning object replacement mechanisms enable error-free runtime modifications to educational curricula.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
